AT0052.title: Malicious Peripherals
AT0052.description: Malicious peripherals are devices into which malicious software writes malicious code via USB interfaces or other means. When the peripheral is plugged into a computer, the malicious code automatically runs, thereby attacking the computer.

AT0052-001.title: KON-Boot
AT0052-001.description: KON-Boot is a tool that bypasses Windows and macOS login passwords. It boots from a USB device to circumvent the login authentication process.

AT0052-002.title: USB Killer
AT0052-002.description: USB Killer is a device that injects high-voltage electrical current into a computer via the USB port, instantly burning out hardware components such as the motherboard, CPU, and RAM.

AT0052-003.title: BadUSB
AT0052-003.description: BadUSB is a USB device pre-loaded with malicious code. When inserted into a computer, the malicious code executes automatically, enabling attacks such as keystroke injection, data exfiltration, or malware installation.
